UpgradeGateway.title: UpgradeGateway
UpgradeGateway.description:
### [](#)Usage notes

When you call this operation, take note of the following items:

*   You can update a gateway that is only in the Running or Activated state.
*   During the update process, the gateway cannot respond to other requests.

**

**Warning** Updating gateways will cause temporary business interruptions. Exercise caution when performing this operation.

DeleteGateway.summary: Deletes a pay-as-you-go gateway from its cluster.

schema.description: The gateway ID.

The type of the reason why you want to delete the gateway. Valid values:

*   REASON1: The gateway fee is too high.
*   REASON2: The gateway is used for testing only and is no longer needed now.
*   REASON3: The gateway feature or performance does not meet the business requirements.
*   REASON4: The new features are highly anticipated.
The detailed reason why you want to delete the gateway.

Code.description: The status code. The status code 200 indicates that the request was successful.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

400.errorMessage: You must enter a valid ID for the gateway.
The specified gateway does not exist. You must specify a valid parameter.
You cannot perform the operation when the gateway is in the current state.
The gateway is processing requests . Try again later.
Invalid request. You must specify valid parameters in the request.
There are file shares or block volumes still under the gateway, please delete them first and then delete the gateway.

DeleteGateway.title: DeleteGateway
DeleteGateway.description:
### [](#)Usage notes

Take note of the following items:

*   You can delete only a pay-as-you-go gateway.
*   You can delete a gateway that is only in the Initialized, Activated, Running, Unknown, Failed, or Stopped state.
*   If you have deleted a gateway using the CSG console, but it still appears in the Resource Management console, this may be due to cached information or synchronization delays. Wait a moment for the system to automatically update the status. If it does not update after an extended period, try refreshing the page or allow the system to synchronize automatically.

**Warning** Deleting a gateway will interrupt business activities and data synchronization tasks. Exercise caution when performing this action.

CreateGatewayFileShare.summary: Creates a share for a file gateway.

schema.description: The gateway ID.
The name of the share. The name must be 1 to 255 characters in length and can contain lowercase letters, digits, periods (.), underscores (\_), and hyphens (-). It must start with a lowercase letter.

The protocol of the share. Valid values:

*   NFS
*   SMB

Specifies whether to enable reverse synchronization for the share. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

The time interval between two consecutive reverse synchronization tasks. Valid values: 15 to 36000

>  In replication mode, if both reverse synchronization and data download are enabled, a valid value for this parameter ranges from 3600 to 36000.

Specifies whether to enable the ignore deletions feature for the share. After you enable the feature, data stored in the OSS bucket is retained if you delete data from the gateway. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

>  This parameter is supported for gateway version 1.0.40 and later.
The upper limit on the write speed of the share. Unit: MB/s. Valid values: 0 to 1280. The default value 0 specifies that the write speed is not limited.

The upper limit on the upload speed of the share. Unit: MB/s. Valid values: 0 to 1280. The default value 0 specifies that the upload speed is not limited.

>  If an upper limit is applied to the write speed, the upper limit on the upload speed must be greater than or equal to the upper speed on the write speed.

Specifies whether to enable the fragmentation optimization feature for the share. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

The data synchronization mode of the share. Valid values:

*   Cache: the cache mode
*   Sync: the replication mode

Specifies whether the share is browsable over the SMB protocol (that is, whether the share is discoverable in the network neighbor). This parameter takes effect only when the ShareProtocol parameter is set to SMB. Valid values:

*   true (default)
*   false

The user mapping for an NFS share. Valid values:

*   none (default)
*   root_squash
*   all_squash
*   all_anonymous
The list of users who have read and write access to the SMB share. Separate multiple users with commas (,). This parameter takes effect only when the ShareProtocol parameter is set to SMB.
The list of users who have read-only access to the SMB share. Separate multiple users with commas (,). This parameter takes effect only when the ShareProtocol parameter is set to SMB.
The IP addresses or CIDR blocks allowed to read and write the NFS share. Separate multiple IP addresses or CIDR blocks with commas (,).
The IP addresses or CIDR blocks allowed to only read the NFS share. Separate multiple IP addresses or CIDR blocks with commas (,).

The name of the OSS bucket.

>  An OSS bucket for which you configure back-to-origin routing is not supported.

The endpoint for the region in which the OSS bucket associated with the share is located.

>  You can specify the internal or public endpoint for a region. If the OSS bucket and the gateway reside in the same region, we recommend that you specify the internal endpoint. Example: oss-cn-shanghai-internal.aliyuncs.com.

Specifies whether to enable Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) connection to the OSS bucket. Valid values:

*   true (default)
*   false

The delay in uploading files from the gateway to the OSS bucket. Unit: seconds. Valid values: 5 to 120. Default value: 5.

>  This parameter is supported for gateway version 1.0.40 and later.

Specifies whether data is directly read from and written to the cache disk. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true
The internal device name of the cache disk for the share. You can call the DescribeGatewayCaches operation to query the internal device name of the cache disk.

Specifies whether to enable server-side encryption for the share. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

>  - The feature is available only to users on the whitelist. To enable the feature, contact the technical support. Server-side encryption and client-side encryption cannot be configured at the same time.

The Key Management Service (KMS) key used for server-side encryption.

>  The key must be in the same region as the gateway.

Specifies whether to enable client-side encryption for the share. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

>  The feature is available only to users on the whitelist. To enable the feature, contact the technical support. Only Enhanced and Performance Optimized gateways support the feature. Server-side encryption and client-side encryption cannot be configured at the same time.

The KMS key used in client-side encryption for the share.

>  The key must be in the same region as the gateway.

The key rotation cycle for client-side encryption. The parameter takes effect only when client-side encryption is enabled for the share. Unit: seconds. Valid values: -3600 to 360 × 86400. The default value 0 indicates that the key is not rotated.
The subdirectory of the OSS bucket. If you leave the parameter empty, the root directory of the OSS bucket is specified.

Specifies whether to enable the upload optimization feature for the share. The feature is suitable for the scenarios where you synchronize backups to the cloud. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

>  This parameter is supported for gateway version 1.0.39 and later.

Specifies whether to allow archiving for the share. This parameter takes effect only when the ShareProtocol parameter is set to NFS.

>  If you enable the feature and access an archived file, a request is initiated to restore the archived file. The request does not trigger error messages. However, the restoration process takes some time to complete. If you do not enable the feature, accessing an archived file throws an error.

Specifies whether to configure a Windows access control list (ACL) for the SMB share. Active Directory is required to configure this setting. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

>  This parameter is supported for gateway version 1.0.45 and later.

Specifies whether to enable Windows access-based enumeration (ABE) for the SMB share. This parameter takes effect only when the WindowsAcl parameter is set to true. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

>  This parameter is supported for gateway version 1.0.45 and later.

Specifies whether to enable fragment optimization based on the Network File System version 4 (NFSv4) protocol to improve the upload efficiency. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

>  After you enable the feature, you cannot mount the share on on-premises clients over NFSv3. This parameter is supported for gateway version 1.2.0 and later.

Specifies whether to enable the transfer acceleration feature for the share. To enable transfer acceleration for the share, you must also enable transfer acceleration for the OSS bucket.

>  This parameter is supported for gateway version 1.3.0 and later.

Specifies whether to download data if the replication mode is enabled. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

>  This parameter takes effect only if the share allows reverse synchronization or is added to an express synchronization group.

The upper limit on the download speed of the share. Unit: MB/s. Valid values: 0 to 1280. The default value 0 specifies that the download speed is not limited.

> 

*   This parameter takes effect only when the replication mode and data download feature are enabled. This parameter takes effect only if the share allows reverse synchronization or is added to an express synchronization group. This parameter is supported for gateway version 1.3.0 and later.

The directories from which you want to synchronize data if the replication mode is enabled.

>  The feature is available only to users on the whitelist. To enable the feature, contact the technical support.

The encryption algorithm. Valid values:

*   AES256 (default)
*   SM4

Specifies whether to directly read data from OSS. Valid values:

*   true
*   false (default)
The virtual IP address used to mount the share. This parameter applies only to a high-availability gateway.

The region in which the OSS bucket associated with the share is located.

>  If the gateway version is greater than or equal to 2.0.0 and this parameter is correctly specified, the gateway uses the OSS Signature V4 to access data in the bucket. If the gateway version is earlier than 2.0.0 or this parameter is not correctly specified, the gateway uses the OSS Signature V1 to access data in the OSS bucket.

Code.description: The status code. The status code 200 indicates that the request was successful.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

400.errorMessage: The specified field %s for file share is invalid. Please check it again.
The specified field %s for file share is not supported by current gateway version. Please check it again.
You can configure the ArchiveSupport parameter only with NFS protocol and when the user mapping value is "none".

CreateGatewayFileShare.title: CreateGatewayFileShare
CreateGatewayFileShare.description:
Before you call the operation, take note of the following items:

*   Make sure that you have created and deployed a file gateway that has an unused cache disk.
*   Make sure that you have created an Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket.

DeleteGatewayFileShares.summary: Deletes a share from a gateway.

schema.description: The gateway ID.
The ID of the share. You can call the DescribeGatewayFileShares operation to query the share ID.

Specifies whether to forcibly delete the share if data synchronization is not complete for the share. Valid values:

*   true: forcibly deletes the share. Proceed with caution.
*   false: does not forcibly delete the share. This is the default value.

Code.description: The status code. The status code 200 indicates that the request was successful.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

DeleteGatewayFileShares.title: DeleteGatewayFileShares
DeleteGatewayFileShares.description:
### [](#)Usage notes

**

**Warning** Deleting shares will interrupt your business continuity and data synchronization tasks. Exercise caution when performing this action.

In the virtual environment where the on-premises gateway is installed, you must first increase the capacity of the cache disk that corresponds to the share.

TagResources.summary: Creates tags and attaches the tags to resources.

schema.description: The region ID. You can call the DescribeRegions operation to query region IDs.
The region ID of the resource.
The type of the resource. Valid value: GATEWAY.
The tag information.

Key.description: The key of the tag. You can create N tag keys for a gateway. Valid values of N: 1 to 20. This parameter cannot be an empty string.

Value.description: The tag value that is associated with the specified tag key. You can create N tag values for a gateway. Valid values of N: 1 to 20. This parameter can be an empty string.

schema.description: The list of gateway IDs. You can attach tags to N gateways at a time. Valid values of N: 1 to 50.

TagResources.title: TagResources
TagResources.description:
If you have a large number of instances, you can create multiple tags and add these tags to the instances. Then, you can query instances by tag.

*   A tag consists of a key and a value. Each key must be unique in a region within an Alibaba Cloud account. Different keys can be mapped to the same value.
*   If you specify a tag that does not exist, the tag is automatically created and added to the specified gateway.
*   If the key of the tag that you want to add to a gateway is the same as the key of an existing tag that is added to the gateway, the tag that you want to add overwrites the existing tag.
*   You can attach up to 20 tags to each gateway.
*   You can attach tags to up to 50 gateways in an API request.
